entry.title: [text-spacing-trim] Use a Trie for `HanKerning::GetCharType`
entry.content:
Last a few rules of "Fullwidth Punctuation Collapsing"[1]

require characters in ASCII, such as U+0028[2]. This makes

optimizing `HanKerning::GetCharType` by early return more

difficult.



This patch moves the logic to the ICU Trie data structure,

built on the build time. The time needed should be almost the

same as getting one Unicode property.



This patch has no behavior changes.



[1] https://drafts.csswg.org/css-text-4/#fullwidth-collapsing

[2] https://util.unicode.org/UnicodeJsps/list-unicodeset.jsp?a=%5B%3Agc%3DPs%3A%5D%5B%3Agc%3DPe%3A%5D&g=&i=



Bug: 1463891

entry.title: sensors: Add virtual sensor commands to browser_protocol.pdl and CDP implementation
entry.content:
Design doc:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1JS2Wnyc9GiS_u1Ry3w4KsCyd51g8fm4RDEUcanZgzbM/edit?usp=sharing



This adds a few types and 3 new commands to the Emulation domain:

* getOverriddenSensorInformation(type: SensorType) -> { requestedSamplingFrequency: number }

* setSensorOverrideEnabled(enabled: boolean, type: SensorType, optional metadata: SensorMetadata)

* setSensorOverrideReadings(type: SensorType, reading: SensorReading)



Together, they allow us to implement the create/get/update/remove

virtual sensor WebDriver commands from the Automation section of the

Generic Sensor spec (the ChromeDriver bits will come later).



Most of the code has already been implemented elsewhere in content and

services. The CDP bits involve exposing the virtual sensor operations

from WebContentsSensorProviderProxy via an RAII object called

ScopedVirtualSensorForDevTools: since the entry point to the virtual

sensor operations is always CDP, this object is responsible for

automatically creating and removing virtual sensors while WCSPP takes

care of creating only one ScopedVirtualSensorForDevTools per sensor

type. This way, each EmulationHandler instance has its own set of

virtual sensors that are cleared when it is disabled, and other handlers

that exist at the same time are unable to create, interact with or

remove these virtual sensors.



[The increase in binary size for Fuchsia cannot be avoided, it all comes

mostly from the generated code for the new data in browser_protocol.pdl and

the new code in content::protocol::EmulationHandler]



Bug: 1278377

Fuchsia-Binary-Size: Size increase is unavoidable.

Change-Id: Ie891bea3f46ff90192ed860f8ffe5361c8485df7

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4770864

Commit-Queue: Raphael Kubo Da Costa

Reviewed-by: Matt Reynolds

Auto-Submit: Raphael Kubo Da Costa

Reviewed-by: Andrey Kosyakov

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1211361}

entry.title: Move promise item attributes to the installed app
entry.content:
Improve interactions between promise app sync data and the target,

"promised" app sync data. Handles two scenarios:

1. New install - when the promise app is installed, copy all of

the promise app's sync item data to the target app's sync data.

2. For install from sync, in which case a target app will have a sync

item, "link" the promise app and the target app's sync items, so

updates from sync get applied to the promise app, and the promise

app updates from ash get applied to the target app.



To support the second case, add a map that links promise app IDs to the

target app IDs to AppListSyncableService. When handling sync updates,

and updates from the UI, AppListSyncableService makes sure that promise

app and the target app are updated together. The "linkage" is

established when ChromeShelfController, or AppServicePromiseAppBuilder

notice a promise app update - because it's used from more than one

place, request to link a promise app to an existing sync item can be

called multiple times (on subsequent calls, the old linked app ID will

get reused).



To support the first use case, add "installed" app ID field to the

PromiseAppUpdate, and on success, provided that the promise app was

not linked to an existing sync item, AppServicePromiseAppBuilder will

copy the promise app sync item attributes to the installed app sync

item.



This CL also adds a PromiseAppRemoved observer interface to

PromiseAppRegistryCache observer, so observers can act upon promise app

removal separately from its final update. This makes sure that

ChromeShelfController or AppServicePromiseAppBuilder don't remove

promise app sync data before the other one has had a chance to set the

target state on the installed item - both classes observer the same

event, and there was potential for ChromeShelfController to unpin the

promise app in response to promise app install completing before the

AppServicePromiseAppBuilder had a chance to copy the promise app pin

ordinal to the installed app.



BUG=b:303927460



Change-Id: Ic07c7c731ebd9a2bc307ea9264c96d5406e84c65

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4925150

Reviewed-by: Maggie Cai

entry.title: [Passwords] Add strong label password experiment for generation
entry.content:
* Allows displaying "Strong password" label in password input forms

* The label starts being displayed whenever user hovers over "suggest

strong password", is still displayed when the user accepts suggested

password

* The label is cleared when the user stops hovering over the "suggest

strong password" or when they edit it after accepting



The functionality is protected by a new runtime feature flag which

generates corresponding Finch feature flag that will be later enabled

for a 1% experiment on Stable (not intended to fully launch).

entry.title: [Files F2] Refine rename/focus logic for directory tree container
entry.content:
* `insertBefore` in the directory tree container causes the tree item

to lose states like focus/rename, we need to restore them if needed.

* Add `renameItemWithKeyWhenRendered/focusItemWithKeyWhenRendered`

methods for the directory tree container to handle cases where we

want to rename/focus items which are not rendered yet.

* When a focused tree item is deleted, we need to update the focused

item to either currently selected item or item which will become

selected later, otherwise the focus will go back to BODY.

* Enable DirectoryTreeContextMenu browser tests with the new tree to

test all above changes.



Bug: b:302642915

Test: browser_tests --gtest_filter="DirectoryTreeContextMenu/*"

entry.title: Reduce allocations in image_operations.cc
entry.content:
The switch to use absl::InlinedVector in https://crrev.com/c/4705412 had

the side-effect of changing the semantics of clear() to free the backing

buffer, which accidentally undid an optimization in

ResizeFilter::ComputeFilters() in skia/ext/image_operations.cc.



Use resize(0) instead of clear() to reduce the number of malloc/free

pairs that are performed in this function.



As an additional optimization, use reserve() to ensure the correct

amount of memory is allocated before starting to use push_back(). Also

replace an indexed loop with a range-based loop.



BUG=1492654



Change-Id: I5909317f84e25918fb689c5b5fc05bdc2c11d4f3

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4942618

entry.title: Sets interval flush by the fragment unit.
entry.content:
The flush interval is determined by the fragment unit.

When an interval time is set for the muxer, it triggers a

flush once the time elapsed since the last flush surpasses the

specified flush interval. However, for mp4, it's essential to have

an accurate 'trun' box that includes the number of samples for

a particular fragment, which implies that splitting the 'trun'

box is not feasible.



The change ensures that the flush is checked solely by

the fragment unit, so the written blob contains complete fragment data.



Bug: 1493523

Change-Id: I3416004408531c4254f519f665fe77b837ef17d9

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4950224

entry.title: [fetch-later] Pipe associated remote of FetchLaterLoaderFactory
entry.content:
# Context #

- `fetchLater()` is a flag-guarded new JS API.

- `FetchLaterLoaderFactory` is introduced as a fetchLater-specific

version of URLLoaderFactory to proxy Renderer->Browser IPC, while

Browser->Network IPC still uses URLLoaderFactory (not relevant to

this CL).

- Explainer: https://github.com/WICG/pending-beacon/blob/main/docs/fetch-later-api.md

- Design Doc: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1U8XSnICPY3j-fjzG35UVm6zjwL6LvX6ETU3T8WrzLyQ/edit



# Before this CL #

https://crrev.com/c/4907851 tries to allow binding

AssociatedRemote from renderer via

`Frame::GetRemoteNavigationAssociatedInterfaces()` (See usage in [1]).

However, not every types of frame can bind it: browser-side impl of

FetchLaterLoaderFactory requires RFHI to have access to a copy of

`subresource_proxying_factory_bundle`, which is ONLY available after

navigation, i.e. RFHI for child frame or noopener window has no

access to it, as renderer just clones the other URLLoaderFactory

interfaces from parent/opener frames without passing

`subresource_proxying_factory_bundle` to RFHI.



# After this CL #

- RFHI passes pending_associated_remote to

RenderFrameImpl via `NavigationClient::CommitNavigation()`.

- Stores mojo::AssociatedRemote in

ChildURLLoaderFactoryBundle, so that it can be initialized/updated/

cloned along with other subresource URLLoaderFactory at the same

time.

- Surfaces `blink::ChildURLLoaderFactoryBundle` to

`blink::LocalFrameClient` via

`WebLocalFrameClient::GetLoaderFactoryBundle()`, so that it can be

used in FetchManager.



[1]: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4892556/21/third_party/blink/renderer/core/fetch/fetch_manager.cc#1586



Bug: 1465781

Change-Id: Idfa6c33cc19faadefe8ad2cd14b3b6df42e1a08d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4936910

Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

Reviewed-by: Rakina Zata Amni

Commit-Queue: Ming-Ying Chung

Reviewed-by: Takashi Toyoshima

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1211297}

entry.title: Revert "Grit: Add a way to inline generated JS files."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 6c28b1a038c495b9c41bcba310e474e9f98cf286.



Reason for revert: May cause https://crbug.com/1493571 as this is the earliest change with that broken builder



Original change's description:

> Grit: Add a way to inline generated JS files.

>

> This is necessary to unblock migrating the following UIs:

> - components/security_interstitials/core/browser/resources/

> - components/neterror/resources/

>

> to JS modules. Those UIs rely on Grit's obsolete flattenhtml=true for

> inlining all involved HTML/CSS/JS files to a single HTML file. The new

> functionality allows using the more appropriate and canonical

> bundle_js() GN rule to generate JS bundles, and have Grit be able to

> inline the generated JS file to the final HTML file.

>

> Done by allowing a `%ROOT_GEN_DIR%` placeholder to appear in a path,

> like `

entry.title: Check GetServableState in FindPrefetchContainerToServe()
entry.content:
This CL stops recording the metric

`PrefetchProxy.AfterClick.BlockUntilHeadDuration.NotServed`

for `PrefetchContainer`s that are not servable in the first

place when the navigation is started (i.e. at the time of

the first `PrefetchService::GetPrefetchToServe()` call),

by checking `GetServableState()` there.



This CL also to unify exact/No-Vary-Search matching and

No-Vary-Search hint matching logic.



In order to still record the metric for `PrefetchContainer`s

that are blocked until head and then turned non-servable later,

this CL replaces the `GetPrefetchToServe()` calls

from `WaitOnPrefetchToServeHead()`

with `HandlePrefetchContainerToServe()`,

so that such `PrefetchContainer`s go through

`GetPrefetchToServe()` -> `WaitOnPrefetchToServeHead()`

-> `HandlePrefetchContainerToServe()`

-> `OnReturnPrefetchToServe()`.



In this way, `GetPrefetchToServe()` and

`FindPrefetchContainerToServe()` are called only once, and

the `PrefetchContainer` references are passed

from `FindPrefetchContainerToServe()` (the single source of

"initial candidates for which metric is to be recorded")

to `OnReturnPrefetchToServe()` that records the metric.



This should be fine as we are ready to remove

`prefetch_ready_to_serve_` in

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4917444.



Bug: 1493192, 1448731

Change-Id: I2d9388c5ce3e9c3f5c81d064e019e5bf839bf606

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4917584

Reviewed-by: Lingqi Chi

Commit-Queue: Hiroshige Hayashizaki

Reviewed-by: Liviu Tinta

entry.title: Pass --disable-field-trial-config to tests that need it.
entry.content:
Affected tests already run without the testing config applied,

so this CL makes it explicit.



Context: Browser tests that use ScopedFeatureList and pass

params presently cause the field trial testing config to be

entirely disabled. (details: crbug.com/1491463#c8)

We plan to fix this, but some existing tests rely on this

(fail with the testing config). This CL annotates those

tests explicitly by making them specify the flag for that.



Once all the CLs updating such tests land (sharded via git

cl split), the following CL to make ScopedFeatureList not

disable the testing config can land:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4935093



As many tests are affected, it will be up to their owners

to do any necessary follow up if the tests should be made to

pass with the testing config (per the comments this CL adds).



Note: I did a best effort to have the new flag only apply to the

subset of tests that needed it when it was a single or a small

number of tests that were affected, by introducing subclasses

for the affected tests. In other cases, where lots of tests in

the same file fail, the flag is added to the original test class.



Note: The --disable-field-trial-config flag is passed simply

by name intentionally, to avoid additional complexity from

depending on components/variations and includes to reference

the existing constant for it. The name is unlikely to change and

this way, we need less complex code to add this to the tests.



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.



R=lingqi@chromium.org



Bug: 1491463

Change-Id: Id17ea92b78bd57848fec304575e5d924297ab1be

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4949370

entry.title: Media Session: Allow exit pip when enterpictureinpicture is provided
entry.content:
With the new web-exposed `enterpictureinpicture` Media Session action,

MediaSessionImpl can get into a state where kEnterPictureInPicture is

an enabled Media Session action, while kExitPictureInPicture is not.

This results in the global media controls UI not properly displaying an

exit picture-in-picture button once pip has been opened via the enter

picture-in-picture button.



This CL ensures that kExitPictureInPicture is also made available

when the website provides an `enterpictureinpicture` handler.



Bug: 1493522

entry.title: Cleanup ShelfModel::ShelfItemFactory interface
entry.content:
Splits up `ShelfModel::ShelfItemFactory::CreateShelfItemForAppId` into

two methods - the method currently creates and returns both a shelf

item for an app ID and shelf item delegate, and the logic for getting

each of them has little overlap. This cl splits the method into two

methods - one to get ShelfItem, and another one to get

ShelfItemDelegate. Also, changes the method signatures to return the

items directly instead of returning them through method arguments.



This has an additional benefit that the CreateShelfItem method can be

used even when the delegate is known. To take advantage of this, move

more the logic for initializing new shelf item in

ShelfItemController::InsertAppItem to the factory (and use the factory

to create the new item). This makes item creation more consistent in

cases items get created in shelf model directly, and should long term

allow us to remove duplicate initialization logic that

ChromeShelfItemController does in shelf item addition observer

(ChromeShelfController::ShelfItemAdded).



Also, moves the factory ownership to shelf item controller, and lets

shelf item controller set the factories active profile to be consistent

with the profile used by the shelf item controller (instead of always

defaulting to the primary profile).



Change-Id: I50496550d09681720964110350309b2e26a0292d

entry.title: Add a test for metrics collection + non-servable PrefetchContainer
entry.content:
After this CL, PrefetchServiceAlwaysBlockUntilHeadTest.

FailedTimeoutWhileBlockUntilHeadForOlderNavigation has

three navigations:



- First navigation is started but gone.

- Second navigation is started, blocked until head but

the PrefetchContainer turned out not servable.

- Third navigation is started but the PrefetchContainer

is not servable in the first place.



The metric

`PrefetchProxy.AfterClick.BlockUntilHeadDuration.NotServed`

should be recorded only for the second navigation.



The metric is currently recorded for the third navigation

but this will be fixed by

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4917584.



Bug: 1493192, 1448731

Change-Id: I4c9f4d7ddaeb67e3e2e783889349a949fd3a342d

entry.title: Improve MultiBufferDataSource MediaLog use
entry.content:
MultiBufferDataSource was keeping around a raw_ptr when that's

been not recommended for even longer than my tenure here. This CL

switches that up to a unique_ptr using the clone feature in

order to prevent UAF usage of the raw pointer. There seems to be a case

where this is possible if |StartCallback| races with Stop, so this CL

also moves the lock check up in the function.



R=liberato

entry.title: Revert "inputs: Use enum to indicate connection mode for IME Service."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 00530e5d95c9c3906bc289f85042001c2c3eb0f6.



Reason for revert: Potential culprit for b/301101120



Original change's description:

> inputs: Use enum to indicate connection mode for IME Service.

>

> IME Service only allows at most one connection, to either:

> - Decoder Engine: The code path used by the IME extension for VK and

> Japanese PK.

> - System Engine: The code path used by all other PK input methods.

>

> When using the System Engine, the IME extension may still be running,

> and may try to send messages to the Decoder Engine. To prevent this,

> IME Service will not allow anyone to connect to the Decoder Engine

> while connected to the System Engine. If a user switches from System

> Engine to Decoder Engine, the System Engine connection must be

> disconnected first, before connecting to the Decoder Engine.

>

> However, there is a timing bug. Suppose the user is switching from

> Chinese (System Engine) to Japanese (Decoder Engine). It is possible

> that Japanese tries to connect to the Decoder Engine before Chinese has

> finished destroying the System Engine. IME Service will erroneously

> block Japanese from connecting.

>

> To mitigate the timing issue, store an enum in IME Service that updates

> ASAP when System Engine disconnects. Then, we can immediately connect to

> the Decoder Engine without having to wait for System Engine to finish

> cleanup (the Decoder Engine connection will block until System Engine

> finishes clean up, instead of just being rejected completely).

>

> There's still a potential timing issue where IME Service receives the

> connection request before the disconnection request. However, this is

> extremely unlikely.

>

> We intend to resolve this issue completely in the future, by migrating

> the IME extension to use modern JS Mojo bindings.

>

> Bug: b/263184460

> Change-Id: I0c7a55ca832f7ace2bee826f1be6058f2715e2b4

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4749340

> Commit-Queue: Darren Shen

> Auto-Submit: Darren Shen

> Reviewed-by: Curtis McMullan

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1184559}



Bug: b/263184460

Change-Id: I49cccc17b21d595b6443d7f3890466ed87e2f711

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4951211

Commit-Queue: Darren Shen

Reviewed-by: Curtis McMullan

Auto-Submit: Darren Shen

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1211227}

entry.title: Make GetServiceWorkerRaceNetworkRequestToken returns optional
entry.content:
A speculative fix for crbug.com/1492640. We're seeing some URL mismatch

inside the custom URLLoaderFactory.



When ServiceWorkerAutoPreload is enabled, URLLoaderFactory being used

from the fetch handler is replaced with the corresponding custom

URLLoaderFactory for the dedupe purpose. This is basically done via the

hash map, which has a token string as a key and URLLoaderFactory as a

value.



The token is set in `service_worker_race_network_request_token_` in the

ResourceRequest class, and the hash map lookup is done in the

LoaderFactoryForWorker::CreateURLLoader. The token is set if the request

is HTTP, however, `service_worker_race_network_request_token_` is not

initialized if the request is not HTTP e.g. extensions, and that allows

the browser to lookup the hash map with uninitialized key, which is not

indended.



This may not be a root cause but we could fix the crash by avoiding the

unexpected hash map lookup.



Bug: 1492640

Change-Id: I1db86bd96102594c227961e40cc39cab9343a90f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4945316

Reviewed-by: Kouhei Ueno

Commit-Queue: Shunya Shishido

Reviewed-by: Yoshisato Yanagisawa

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1211216}

entry.title: [bookmarks] Use LazyOneshotSupplier for bookmark images
entry.content:
Using LazyOneshotSupplier allows the callbacks to be setup eagerly,

but only fulfilled when the view is bound. This will prevent us from

making a bunch of image requests right when the ModelList is created.

Instead those image requests can be made when the view is bound.



Bug: 1481191, 1481256

Change-Id: Ied8a64423c5df2537b12ccbda732d5a68065883d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4932285

Reviewed-by: Sky Malice

Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

Commit-Queue: Brandon Wylie

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1211195}

entry.title: Mac: don't defer child window removal during fullscreen transition
entry.content:
When deciding whether to defer a removal or not, we look at whether

we're in the active space. If not, we defer until we become active

again. The intention is to avoid inactive windows becoming active

because a child was removed.



Unfortunately, during a fullscreen transition, even an active

window is temporarily not on an active space. When this happens,

we can defer a removal, but never process it, leaving a (temporarily)

immortal window which can block input.



Bug: 1492984

Change-Id: Iad21f8b3c5c54aa424c9a2b42fc31a5a3fd04cf3

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4947693

entry.title: Pass --disable-field-trial-config to tests that need it.
entry.content:
Affected tests already run without the testing config applied,

so this CL makes it explicit.



Context: Browser tests that use ScopedFeatureList and pass

params presently cause the field trial testing config to be

entirely disabled. (details: crbug.com/1491463#c8)

We plan to fix this, but some existing tests rely on this

(fail with the testing config). This CL annotates those

tests explicitly by making them specify the flag for that.



Once all the CLs updating such tests land (sharded via git

cl split), the following CL to make ScopedFeatureList not

disable the testing config can land:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4935093



As many tests are affected, it will be up to their owners

to do any necessary follow up if the tests should be made to

pass with the testing config (per the comments this CL adds).



Note: I did a best effort to have the new flag only apply to the

subset of tests that needed it when it was a single or a small

number of tests that were affected, by introducing subclasses

for the affected tests. In other cases, where lots of tests in

the same file fail, the flag is added to the original test class.



Note: The --disable-field-trial-config flag is passed simply

by name intentionally, to avoid additional complexity from

depending on components/variations and includes to reference

the existing constant for it. The name is unlikely to change and

this way, we need less complex code to add this to the tests.



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.



R=ayman@chromium.org



Bug: 1491463

Change-Id: Idde8bc38c2341490d1e8027248f1c13925e1cf56

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4943672

Auto-Submit: Alexei Svitkine

entry.title: Stop existing host before creating a new host instance
entry.content:
The new service call will handle deleting an existing host instance

(which will cause a running host to stop) when the existing host_id

is provided. This CL uses a similar approach to the HostStopper

class except we don't need a separate Delete call so the Daemon

call can be folded into the existing CorpHostStarter class cleanly.

entry.title: [Extensions] Clean up Alarms API usage of TimeDelta
entry.content:
The alarms API has limits on the minimum granularity for alarms.

Currently, these use a weird (and conceptually incorrect, though the

end result is the proper behavior) mishmash of TimeDelta and double

multiplication to compare the limits.



Fix this and just use base::TimeDelta, reducing LOC and improving

readability.



This CL has no behavior change.



Bug: None

Change-Id: I6d28b9278ff501aafc7f8839d3b6f26b55f3ba1f

entry.title: [FSA] Use shadow grants to auto-grant a permission request.
entry.content:
This prevents grants being lost after a page refresh. Shadow grants

are used to handle this case.



This CL also adds a small optimization to check whether an origin

has empty persisted grants before checking ancestor's persistent

permission recursively.

entry.title: CrOS Settings: Fix flaky OSSettingsDevicePagePower* test
entry.content:
This CL fixes flakiness of the related browser test. My suspicion is

the test failures were caused by a race condition of the order of

'battery-status-changed' events received. In order to predictably

control the order of these events, the tests are updated to wait for

the first event occurrence after element setup and before continuing to

the test execution.



Bug: b:303702729, b:305993270

Test: browser_test --gtest_filter="OSSettingsDevicePagePower*"

entry.title: Change background painter to use enclosed rect
entry.content:
The background painter used to use enclosing rect instead of enclosed

rect. This causes an issue when a border is applied, because it is

possible for edges (namely right and bottom edge) to be draw outside of

the canvas. This results in a 1px clipping along those edges.



This is mainly noticeable on ChromeOS devices because some have a scale

factor by default. This is also made more noticeable because of the

round buttons in the 2023 refresh.



Fixed: 1487188

Change-Id: I4122b89d75c2e8cb9cfa5db56e5705c14518a153

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4944679

Commit-Queue: Fred Shih

Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

Reviewed-by: Peter Kasting

Reviewed-by: David Yeung
